definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
good will always triumph over evil (idiom)

sentences.english: Before the Indians realized what was happening, they were outnumbered.
sentences.chinese: 當印第安人意識到發生了什麼，他們已經寡不敵衆了。

sentences.english: But in the end, brave William, more than a match for ten thousand men, was betrayed by a hateful fellow.
sentences.chinese: 可是最後有着萬夫不敵之勇的威廉被人出賣。

sentences.english: Even without those two Death Eaters, Harry is still outnumbered.
sentences.chinese: 即便沒有那兩個食死徒，哈利仍然寡不敵衆。

sentences.english: After a fierce battle, outnumbered army of peasants, most captured.
sentences.chinese: 一場激戰後，農民軍寡不敵衆，多數被俘。

sentences.english: The Thai workmen were hopelessly outnumbered.
Great Britain's hockey players were outmanoeuvred by Germany.
sentences.chinese: 英國曲棍球隊不敵德國隊。

sentences.english: The girl was brave enough, but as being outnumbered, she wasfinally knocked into the middle of next week by thegang.
sentences.chinese: 她很勇敢，但終因寡不敵衆，被那幫人打暈過去。

sentences.english: Two people in the navy general affairs department is seriously injured, outnumbered.
sentences.chinese: 二人在海軍總務部皆身受重傷，寡不敵衆。

sentences.english: "White little" and I are losing the fight.
The stone be outnumbered by a group of Japanese control.
sentences.chinese: 石頭寡不敵衆被一夥日本人控制住。

sentences.english: The defenders were outnumbered and had to give in.
sentences.chinese: 那些抵抗者寡不敵衆，只得投降。

definition: to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
St Paul/São Paulo, city in Brazil
to fit one into the other/to bring two things into contact
to win by a narrow margin/to barely win/narrow victory
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
